title: Irreducible polynomials over GF2
text: Find the number of degreenirreducible polynomials over GF(2). For example: for n=1 there are two such polynomials: x and x+1. For n=2 there is only one: x2+x+1. Note that in R[x] the polynomials x2+1 is irreducible, but not over GF(2), because x2+1 = (x+1)*(x+1)InputA single positive integern, wheren< 500000.OutputOutput the answer forn.ExampleInput:201Output:15989433276208858463104100421305100522608250813995004946218Input:1Output:2Input:2Output:1Input:3Output:2
